SUMMARY: Xylose regulator, XylR, is a transcription factor involved in d-xylose degradation. It coregulates with CRP, a global transcriptional regulator [9371449]. se regulators bind cooperatively to activate transcription of operons involved in transport and catabolism of d-xylose. Synsis of se operons is induced when Escherichia coli is grown on d-xylose in absence of glucose. Gene induction occurs when physiological inducer, d-xylose, binds to XylR and when cellular cyclic AMP levels are high [9371449]. In presence of d-xylose, XylR binds in tandem to four inverted repeat sequences in xylAB/xylFGHR intergenic region to activate transcription by overlapping ?35 boxes of xylABp and xylFGHRp [9371449]. binding targets for XylR consist of 18-nucleotide-long directed repeat sequences that possess conserved motifs; each monomer binds to one of se conserved sequences [9371449, 11750821] XylR belongs to AraC/XylS family [9409145, 11752325].
